intro: Avena bromoides f. flava, commonly known as yellow oatgrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The inflorescence consists of spikelets that bear small, yellowish flowers, which are typical of the genus Avena. This plant thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, often forming dense mats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native landscaping.
